note.title: JSch - Java Secure Channel
note.p: JSch is a pure Java implementation of SSH2.

JSch allows you to connect to an sshd server and use port forwarding, X11 forwarding, file transfer, etc., and you can integrate its functionality into your own Java programs. JSch is licensed under BSD style license.

note.title: JSch - Java Secure Channel
note.p: JSch is a pure Java implementation of SSH2.

JSch allows you to connect to an sshd server and use port forwarding, X11 forwarding, file transfer, etc., and you can integrate its functionality into your own Java programs. JSch is licensed under BSD style license.

note.div: Der Name eines Jobs. Es kann eine Liste von Jobs mit Komma oder Semikolon getrennt angegeben werden. Die entsprechende Abfrage wird dann für jeden Eintrag geprüft und mit logisch UND verknüpft. job_name oder job_chain_name muss angegeben sein.

The name of a job. It is possible to specify a list of jobs delimitted by a comma or a semicoln. The assigned query will the be executed for each entry and will be evaluated with a logical AND. job_name or job_chain_name must be set.

Der Name einer Job-Kette. Es kann eine Liste von Jobketten mit Komma oder Semikolon getrennt angegeben werden. Die entsprechende Abfrage wird dann für jeden Eintrag geprüft und mit logisch UND verknüpft. job_name oder job_chain_name muss angegeben sein.

The name of a job chain.It is possible to specify a list of job chains delimitted by a comma or a semicoln. The assigned query will the be executed for each entry and will be evaluated with a logical AND. job_name or job_chain_name must be set.

Text im Email-Betreff der Email und im Protokoll.
[JOB_NAME] wird durch den Wert des Parameters JobName substituiert.

Text in the email subject and in the log.
[JOB_NAME] will be substituted with the value of the parameter JobName.

div.p:
Zeitpunkt, ab dem geprüft wird, ob der übergebene Job gestartet ist oder nicht.
Der Zeitpunkt wird in der Form [- Anzahl Tage ab heute][:Uhrzeit(HH:MM[:SS])] angegeben.
Beispiele: -1:12:00:00 = -1:12:00 = prüft ab gestern 12 Uhr -7 = prüft die letzte Woche bei aktueller Uhrzeit
Damit entspricht die Voreinstellung der letzten Mitternacht. Der Parameter wird ausgewertet, wenn der Parameter query eines der folgenden Wert hat und selber keine Startzeit z.B. isStartedAfter(-1:12:00:00) definiert
isStartedAfter
isStartedSuccessfulAfter
isStartedWithErrorAfter

note.div:
The start time from which the parametrisized job is checked whether it has started or not.
The start time must be set in the form [- Count of days from now][:Time(HH:MM[:SS])], so that the default value is last midnight. The parameter will be evaluated if the query has one of the following values and does not set a start_time e.g. isStartedAfter(-1:12:00:00) .
isStartedAfter
isStartedSuccessfulAfter
isStartedWithErrorAfter
Examples: -1:12:00:00 = -1:12:00 = checks from yesterday 12h -7 = checks from the last week with the current time

div.p:
Zeitpunkt, ab dem geprüft wird, ob der übergebene Job gelaufen ist oder nicht.
Der Zeitpunkt wird in der Form [- Anzahl Tage ab heute][:Uhrzeit(HH:MM[:SS])] angegeben.
Beispiele: -1:12:00:00 = -1:12:00 = prüft ab gestern 12Uhr -7 = prüft die letzte Woche bei aktueller Uhrzeit
Damit entspricht die Voreinstellung der letzten Mitternacht. Der Parameter wird ausgewertet, wenn der Parameter query eines der folgenden Wert hat und selber keine Startzeit definiert
isCompletedAfter
isCompletedBefore
isCompletedSuccessfulAfter
isCompletedSuccessfulBefore
isCompletedWithErrorAfter
isCompletedWithErrorBefore

note.div:
The start time from which the parametrisized job is checked whether it has run or not.
The start time must be set in the form [- Count of days from now][:Time(HH:MM[:SS])], so that the default value is last midnight. The parameter will be evaluated if the query has one of the following values and does not set a start_time.
isCompletedAfter
isCompletedBefore
isCompletedSuccessfulAfter
isCompletedSuccessfulBefore
isCompletedWithErrorAfter
isCompletedWithErrorBefore
Examples: -1:12:00:00 = -1:12:00 = checks from yesterday 12h -7 = checks from the last week with the current time

div.p:
Folgende Abfragen stehen zur Verfügung. Die Angabe von start_time und end_time ist optional. Fehlen diese Angaben, werden die Parameter start_time und end_time ausgewertet. Es können mehrere Abfragen mit Komma oder Semikolon getrennt angegeben werden. Diese werden dann korrespondierend der mit Komma oder Semikolon getrennte Liste der Jobs bzw. Jobketten zugewiesen. Wenn mehr Jobs als Abfragen definiert sind, wird die letzte Abfrage in der Liste für alle folgenden Jobs bzw. Jobketten verwendet.
isStartedToday: True, if the job has been started today.
isStartedTodayCompleted: True, if the job has been started today and has completed. It doesn't matter whether ended successfully or with an error.
isStartedTodayCompletedSuccessful: True, if the job has been started today and has ended successfully today.
isStartedTodayCompletedWithError: True, if the job has been started today and has ended in error today.
isStartedAfter (start_time): True, if the job has been started after the given time.
isStartedSuccessfulAfter (start_time): True, if the job has been started after the given time and ended succesfully.
isStartedWithErrorAfter (start_time): True, if the job has been started after the given time and ended with an error.
isCompletedToday: True, if the job has ended today.
isCompletedTodaySuccessful: True, if the job has ended successfully today.
isCompletedTodayWithError: True, if the job has ended in error today.
isCompletedAfter (end_time): True, if the job has ended after the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulAfter (end_time): True, if the job has ended successful after the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorAfter (end_time): True, if the job has ended with an error after the given time.
isCompletedBefore (end_time): True, if the job has been completed before the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulBefore (end_time): True, if the job has been completed successful before the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorBefore (end_time): True, if the job has been completed with an error before the given time.
lastCompletedIsStartedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job was started before the given time.
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsStartedBefore (end_time): True, if the last successful completion of the job was started before the given time.
lastCompletedWithErrorIsStartedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job with an error was started before the given time.
lastCompletedIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job was before the given time.
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, if the last successful completion of the job was before the given time.
lastCompletedWithErrorIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job with an error was before the given time.
Wenn eine Auswertung false liefert, beendet sich der Job mit einem Fehler. Das Ergebnis wird außerdem auf dem Parameter result zurückgeliefert.

These queries are available. The setting for start_time and end_time is optional. When missing, the parameters start_time and end_time will be taken. It is possible to define a list of queries with comma or semicolon as the delimiter. Each entry in the list will be assigned to the corresponding entry in the list of jobs or job chains. If there are more jobs or job chains than queries, the last entry in the query list will be assigned to each following job or job chain.
isStartedToday: True, if the job has been started today.
isStartedTodayCompleted: True, if the job has been started today and has completed. It doesn't matter whether ended successfully or with an error.
isStartedTodayCompletedSuccessful: True, if the job has been started today and has ended successfully today.
isStartedTodayCompletedWithError: True, if the job has been started today and has ended in error today.
isStartedAfter (start_time): True, if the job has been started after the given time.
isStartedSuccessfulAfter (start_time): True, if the job has been started after the given time and ended succesfully.
isStartedWithErrorAfter (start_time): True, if the job has been started after the given time and ended with an error.
isCompletedToday: True, if the job has ended today.
isCompletedTodaySuccessful: True, if the job has ended successfully today.
isCompletedTodayWithError: True, if the job has ended in error today.
isCompletedAfter (end_time): True, if the job has ended after the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulAfter (end_time): True, if the job has ended successful after the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorAfter (end_time): True, if the job has ended with an error after the given time.
isCompletedBefore (end_time): True, if the job has been completed before the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulBefore (end_time): True, if the job has been completed successful before the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorBefore (end_time): True, if the job has been completed with an error before the given time.
lastCompletedIsStartedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job was started before the given time.
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsStartedBefore (end_time): True, if the last successful completion of the job was started before the given time.
lastCompletedWithErrorIsStartedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job with an error was started before the given time.
lastCompletedIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job was before the given time.
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, if the last successful completion of the job was before the given time.
lastCompletedWithErrorIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, if the last completion of the job with an error was before the given time.
When the result is false the job ends with an error. The result will be given with the parameter result.
Legt fest, ob im Falle einer Auswertung der angegebenen query zu false der Job mit einem Fehler beendet werden soll.
Defines whether the job should return with an error in case that the query is evaluated to false
Legt fest, ob im Falle einer Auswertung der angegebenen query zu true der Job mit einem Fehler beendet werden soll.
Defines whether the job should return with an error in case that the query is evaluated to true

note.div: Email-Adresse des Empfängers, see ./config/factory.ini, log_mail_to.
Email address of the recipient, see ./config/factory.ini, log_mail_to.
Email-CC-Adresse des Empfängers, see ./config/factory.ini, log_mail_cc.
Email carbon copy address of the recipient, see ./config/factory.ini, log_mail_cc.

div.p: Email-BCC-Adresse des Empfängers, see ./config/factory.ini, log_mail_bcc.
Email blind carbon copy address of the recipient, see ./config/factory.ini, log_mail_bcc.

note.title: Speicherort der Credential Keystore Datei
note.p: Der Name der Keepass Datei, die die Credentials für den Zugriff auf die Datenbank enthält.
Alternativ kann der Wert des Parameters in der Url mit ?file= angegeben werden.

div.title: Location of the Credential Store file
div.p: The name of the keepass file that contains the credentials for the access to the database.
Alternatively it is possible to specify the value in the url with ?file=

note.title: Speicherort der Credential Keystore Schlüssel Datei
note.p: Der Name der Keepass Schlüssel Datei, die den Schlüssel für den Zugriff auf die Keepass Datei enthält (falls diese mit einer Schlüsseldatei geschützt ist). Wenn keine Keypass Schlüsseldatei angegeben wird, wird der Name der aus dem Namen der Keepass Datei gebildet indem die Erweiterung durch .key ersetzt wird.
Alternativ kann der Wert des Parameters in der Url mit ?keyfile= angegeben werden.

div.title: Location of the Credential Store file
div.p: The name of the keepass key file that contains the key for the credentials for the access to the database (if a key file is assigned to the keepass file). When no keepass key file is given, the file name is build with the name of the keepass file with changing the extension to .key.
Alternatively it is possible to specify the value in the url with ?keyfile=

note.title: Pfad für die Einträge in der Keepass Datei
note.p: Der Pfad der die Entries in der Keepass Datei enthält. Dient dazu die Angabe der Werte zu vereinfachen indem der Pfad nur einmal angegeben werden muss.
Alternativ kann der Wert des Parameters in der Url mit ?entry_path= angegeben werden.

div.title: Path for the entries in the keepass file
div.p:
To speciy a path for all entries. This makes the values for e.g. the password shorter. Example:
credential_store_entry_path=/sos/scheduler value for password: cs://mydb In the keepass file you find the entry in /sos/scheduler/mydb
Alternatively it is possible to specify the value in the url with ?entry_path=
Der Job prüft die Läufe eines als Parameter übergebenen Jobs. Prüfkriterien sind entsprechend des Parametes query gesetzt. Default ist

ul.li: Ist der übergebenen Job fehlerfrei gelaufen?
Ist der übergebenen Job rechtzeitig beendet worden?

div.p:
Der Job geht in den Fehlerzustand, wenn der übergebene Job die Prüfkriterien nicht erfüllt. Daher sollte der Job mit dem Attribut stop_on_error="no" konfiguriert werden.
Soll im Fehlerfall eine Email versendet werden, so ist das settings-Element zu füllen.
Beispiel:
(/checkHistory.job.xml) <job title="Checks the last job run" order="yes" stop_on_error="no"> <settings> <mail_on_error>yes</mail_on_error> <mail_on_warning>yes</mail_on_warning> </settings> <script language="java" java_class="com.sos.jitl.checkhistory.JobSchedulerCheckHistoryJSAdapterClass" /> </job>
(/checkHistory,myJob.order.xml) <order title="Checks myJob"> <params> <param name="JobName" value="/myJob" /> <param name="message" value="Der Job [JOB_NAME] ist heute bis 15:00h noch nicht erfolgreich gelaufen." /> <param name="start_time" value="0:00:00:00" /> <param name="mail_to" value="admin@mycompany.com" /> </params> <run_time> <period single_start="15:00"/> </run_time> </order>
(/checkHistory.job_chain.xml) <job_chain title="Checks the last job runs" orders_recoverable="no" visible="yes"> <job_chain_node state="check" job="checkHistory" next_state="success" error_state="error"/> <job_chain_node.end state="success"/> <job_chain_node.end state="error"/> </job_chain>

The following queries are available. The setting for start_time and end_time is optional. When missing, the parameters start_time and end_time will be taken. It is possible to define a list of queries with comma or semicolon as the delimiter. Each entry in the list will be assigned to the corresponding entry in the list of jobs or job chains. If there are more jobs or job chains than queries, the last entry in the query list will be assigned to each following job or job chain.

ul.li: isStartedToday: True, when started today.
isStartedTodayCompleted: True, when started and completed today.
isStartedTodayCompletedSuccessful: True, when started and completed sucdessful today.
isStartedTodayCompletedWithError: True, when started and completed with error today.
isStartedAfter (start_time): True, when started after the given time.
isStartedSuccessfulAfter (start_time): True, when started after the given time and ended succesful
isStartedWithErrorAfter (start_time): True, when started after the given time and ended with error
isCompletedToday: True, when completed today.
isCompletedTodaySuccessful: True, when completed today successful.
isCompletedTodayWithError: True, when completed today with error.
isCompletedAfter (end_time): True, when ended after the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulAfter (end_time): True, when ended successful after the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorAfter (end_time): True, when ended with error after the given time.
isCompletedBefore (end_time): True, when ende before the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulBefore (end_time): True, when ended successful before the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorBefore (end_time): True, when ended with error before the given time.
lastCompletedIsStartedBefore (end_time): .
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsStartedBefore (end_time): .
lastCompletedWithErrorIsStartedBefore (end_time): .
lastCompletedIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, when the last completion ended before the given time.
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, when the last successful completion ended before the given time.
lastCompletedWithErrorIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, when the last completion in error ended before the given time.
lastSuccessfulCompletedRunEndedAtTop: True, when the last successful ended is at top in the history (position 0)
lastWithErrorCompletedRunEndedAtTop: True, when the last with error ended is at top in the history (position 0)
lastSuccessfulCompletedRunendedTodayAtTop: True, when the last successful ended is at top in the history (position 0) and ended today
lastWithErrorCompletedRunendedTodayAtTop: True, when the last with error ended is at top in the history (position 0) and ended today
lastCompletedRunEndedSuccessful: True, when the last ended was successful
lastCompletedRunEndedWithError: True, when the last ended has an error
lastCompletedRunEndedTodaySuccessful: True, when the last ended was successful and ended today
lastCompletedRunEndedTodayWithError: True, when the last ended has an error and ended today

div.p: When the result is false the job ends with an error. The result will be given with the parameter result.
For more information see:

li.a: Checking the job history in job monitors by use of web services

div.p: This job checks the last run of a parameterised job. Check criteria are set using the query parameter. The default is:

ul.li: Has the job run successfully?
Did the job finish on time?

div.p:
The job comes in the error state if the parametrised job does not perform the check criteria. The job should therefore be configured with the stop_on_error="no" attribute.
If an email notification required in the event of an error then the settings element must be set.
Example:
(/checkHistory.job.xml) <job title="Checks the last job run" order="yes" stop_on_error="no"> <settings> <mail_on_error>yes</mail_on_error> <mail_on_warning>yes</mail_on_warning> </settings> <script language="java" java_class="com.sos.scheduler.checkhistory.JobSchedulerCheckHistoryJSAdapterClass" /> </job>
(/checkHistory,myJob.order.xml) <order title="Checks myJob"> <params> <param name="JobName" value="/myJob" /> <param name="message" value="The Job [JOB_NAME] was not running successfully today until 15:00h." /> <param name="start_time" value="0:00:00:00" /> <param name="mail_to" value="admin@mycompany.com" /> </params> <run_time> <period single_start="15:00"/> </run_time> </order>
(/checkHistory.job_chain.xml) <job_chain title="Checks the last job runs" orders_recoverable="no" visible="yes"> <job_chain_node state="check" job="checkHistory" next_state="success" error_state="error"/> <job_chain_node.end state="success"/> <job_chain_node.end state="error"/> </job_chain>

The following queries are available. The setting for start_time and end_time is optional. When missing, the parameters start_time and end_time will be taken. It is possible to define a list of queries with comma or semicolon as the delimiter. Each entry in the list will be assigned to the corresponding entry in the list of jobs or job chains. If there are more jobs or job chains than queries, the last entry in the query list will be assigned to each following job or job chain.

ul.li: isStartedToday: True, when started today.
isStartedTodayCompleted: True, when started and completed today.
isStartedTodayCompletedSuccessful: True, when started and completed sucdessful today.
isStartedTodayCompletedWithError: True, when started and completed with error today.
isStartedAfter (start_time): True, when started after the given time.
isStartedSuccessfulAfter (start_time): True, when started after the given time and ended succesful
isStartedWithErrorAfter (start_time): True, when started after the given time and ended with error
isCompletedToday: True, when completed today.
isCompletedTodaySuccessful: True, when completed today successful.
isCompletedTodayWithError: True, when completed today with error.
isCompletedAfter (end_time): True, when ended after the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulAfter (end_time): True, when ended successful after the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorAfter (end_time): True, when ended with error after the given time.
isCompletedBefore (end_time): True, when ende before the given time.
isCompletedSuccessfulBefore (end_time): True, when ended successful before the given time.
isCompletedWithErrorBefore (end_time): True, when ended with error before the given time.
lastCompletedIsStartedBefore (end_time): .
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsStartedBefore (end_time): .
lastCompletedWithErrorIsStartedBefore (end_time): .
lastCompletedIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, when the last completion ended before the given time.
lastCompletedSuccessfulIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, when the last successful completion ended before the given time.
lastCompletedWithErrorIsEndedBefore (end_time): True, when the last completion in error ended before the given time.
lastSuccessfulCompletedRunEndedAtTop: True, when the last successful ended is at top in the history (position 0)
lastWithErrorCompletedRunEndedAtTop: True, when the last with error ended is at top in the history (position 0)
lastSuccessfulCompletedRunendedTodayAtTop: True, when the last successful ended is at top in the history (position 0) and ended today
lastWithErrorCompletedRunendedTodayAtTop: True, when the last with error ended is at top in the history (position 0) and ended today
lastCompletedRunEndedSuccessful: True, when the last ended was successful
lastCompletedRunEndedWithError: True, when the last ended has an error
lastCompletedRunEndedTodaySuccessful: True, when the last ended was successful and ended today
lastCompletedRunEndedTodayWithError: True, when the last ended has an error and ended today

div.p: When the result is false the job ends with an error. The result will be given with the parameter result.
For more information see:

li.a: Checking the job history in job monitors by use of web services
